name: Springy Vegetable Quiche
description: Springy Vegetable Quiche! Fresh sautéed spring vegetables with creamy and cheesy eggs, all baked into a flaky pie crust. Easiest fancy-feeling brunch!
keywords: quiche, vegetable quiche, spring quiche, brunch quiche, pie crust, spring brunch
recipeIngredient: 2 cups veggies – I used mushrooms, asparagus, and spinach
8 Simply Nature Organic Grade A Cage Free Eggs
1 cup Emporium Selection Specialty Shredded Gouda Cheese

recipeInstructions.text: Melt the butter over medium high heat. Add the mushrooms; sauté until browned and soft. Add the shallots; sauté until fragrant. Add asparagus; sauté until softened and bright green. Season with a pinch of salt.

video.name: Springy Vegetable Quiche Step 1
video.description: Melt the butter over medium high heat. Add the mushrooms; sauté until browned and soft. Add the shallots; sauté until fragrant. Add asparagus; sauté until softened and bright green. Season with a pinch of salt.

recipeInstructions.text: Whisk eggs and heavy cream together. Add cooked veggies, cheese, and salt.

video.name: Springy Vegetable Quiche Step 2
video.description: Whisk eggs and heavy cream together. Add cooked veggies, cheese, and salt.

recipeInstructions.text: Press pie crust into a 10-inch pie pan and gently crimp the edges so they look nice. (This recipe is enough for two quiches, so just do this twice if you’re making both at the same time.)

video.name: Springy Vegetable Quiche Step 3
video.description: Press pie crust into a 10-inch pie pan and gently crimp the edges so they look nice.

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Poke tiny holes in the bottom of the crust with a fork. Bake the pie crust for 10 minutes, until partially baked.

video.name: Springy Vegetable Quiche Step 4
video.description: Poke tiny holes in the bottom of the crust with a fork. Bake the pie crust for 10 minutes, until partially baked.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour the egg and veggie mixture into the pie dish (stop when you start to get to the top of the pie edges). Bake for 15 minutes.

video.name: Springy Vegetable Quiche Step 5
video.description: Pour the egg and veggie mixture into the pie dish (stop when you start to get to the top of the pie edges)

recipeInstructions.text: Remove pan from oven and cover the pie edges with a foil crown so the edges don’t overbrown. Bake for another 15 minutes.

video.name: Springy Vegetable Quiche Step 6
video.description: Remove pan from oven and cover the pie edges with a foil crown so the edges don't overbrown. Bake for another 15 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Slice and serve! Serve with a little spring mix salad, fruit, or muffins for brunch goals. Yum.

video.name: Springy Vegetable Quiche Step 7
video.description: Slice and serve! Serve with a little spring mix salad, fruit, or muffins for brunch goals. Yum.

review.reviewBody: So, I baked it for about 40 minutes.  Delicious!!  The kids even gobbled it up.  My 9 year old is asking for a second piece right now!
It seems like our weekend is sorted. I have all the ingredients in pantry. Such an easy recipe. I guess we all need som easy and fuss free recipes these days. Take care your self guys.

I made this for dinner tonight and it’s a keeper!  My husband said it was the best quiche he’s ever had, and I agree. I did add about 1/2 c diced ham and it took another 10 mins in the oven to finish cooking through to the middle. But it was perfect for a light dinner with a salad. Thank you!

First time I made quiche...and it will not be the last! Oh my! This dish is so tasty! Fluffy eggs, smooth texture, delicious veggies...even the 15 YO liked it! I also like that it was easy to follow your directions and easy to make. I think this is my 3rd recipe of yours I've made. I'll keep coming back!
Two years later...and it is my favorite brunch dish! I also love making this on the weekend and having breakfast for the rest of the week. Makes mornings so much better!
Made this tonight and it is SO good! I followed the recipe exactly but baked it for 40 min and didn’t cover the edges with foil. It turned out incredible with a side salad. So much yum
So so delicious!  Thank you, POY!
looking so delicious..i want to try it yummy
The Badr vs. Benny fight was initially expected to take place at the Ahoy Arena in Rotterdam, Holland in June, serving as the headliner of

I have to say this recipe came out exactly as advertised; exceptionally light, fluffy and creamy. The entire family, including the two teenagers, devoured it. Only change I made was using a store bought gluten-free crust bc my wife is GF and it made her so happy. An absolute winner, so, thank you!

This was so good!  I made it on Easter, the only ingredient modification I made was to add a healthy sprinkle of Italian seasoning to it. I also used a pre-made crust and didn't cover the edges with foil  the last 15 minutes (the edges didn't burn). I even forgot to add the cheese in the mixture and then remembered after 5 minutes in the oven - so I tossed it in and stirred it with a spoon LOL. It came out beautifully and was a huge hit with my family.  This will be joining the rotation of my weekly recipes.  It was so easy to make and a crowd pleaser.
Made this together with my 18 month old daughter as a morning activity - we had fun, super easy, and delicious! Definitely making this again!
